zone.name: Doom: The Plane of the Air

carrying.name: (the wing feather of a cavern hawk)

mobs.long_desc: A cloud of smoke coalesces into a formidable opponent!
mobs.desc: Before you is Shrynn, Lord of the Air.  His huge body is composed of the force of the air--swirling mist and smoke, moving like a tornado wind.  His body, below the torso, is a tornado funnel.  You can see through parts of his body, so ethereal is he, but there is nothing soft or negligible about how powerful he looks.

mobs.long_desc: A swirling cloud of air coalesces into a man!
mobs.desc: You think as quickly as you can, trying to remember what you've read about the famous Ifrits.  They're more powerful than genies, you recall, and generally consider themselves the leaders of whatever plane they call home.  And they have horrible tempers!  This one looks pretty representative of the genre-- huge, muscled, with his lower body obscured by a whirlwind cloud...and with a fierce frown, directed at you.

mobs.long_desc: A torrential windstorm is coming right at you!
mobs.desc: This is like no other storm you've ever seen!  It moves with what you'd swear was intelligent purpose, its winds and rain cloaked all around it.  In its depths you see debris that must be hundreds of years old.  And you realize that it won't rest until it's destroyed you...

mobs.long_desc: A man surrounded by storm winds plays with a tornado here!
mobs.desc: How could this be?  This man stands shirtless in a freezing wind that makes you shiver even in all your equipment.  His bronze skin is almost oiled, so supple and so muscled you want to touch him just to see if he's real.  His hair, what little you can see of it beneath his turban, is short and black.  He laughs, not even taking you seriously once he's noticed you.  Lightning crackles from his fingertips, and from his eyes.

mobs.long_desc: A mighty blue dragon roars when it sees you!
mobs.desc: Though you have, of course, read about dragons, even seen pictures of them, nothing has prepared you adequately for what confronts your unbelieving eyes-- silver-blue scales catch the sunlight and reflect it in a hundred scintillating points of white light, on a dragon easily the size of a large building.  Its long neck swings around like some gigantic crane, supporting a surprisingly small head composed mostly of jaws and luminous blue cat's-eyes.  Its vestigial wings are folded neatly against its crested back; its tail is coiled as if it could use it in a fight.  And, of course, it smells like a burning village, forcing you a step back.  Truly, you've found a formidable opponent.

mobs.long_desc: A young, towheaded girl looks up as you enter her room.
mobs.desc: You've never seen such an adorable little girl.  She can't be much older than eight or so, and she's short for her age.  A slender little moppet, with her almost-white flaxen hair cut to barely brush her tiny shoulders.  Her huge blue eyes don't blink as she watches you.  You can't imagine how she could be harmful.  In her white pullover shirt and her blue overalls and her bare feet, she presents an absolutely precious picture.

mobs.long_desc: A gigantic dragon with white and blue scales rests here.
mobs.desc: You've found a close relative of the Blue Dragon in this monstrous creature before you.  Impossibly huge, it's covered in variegated blue and silver-white scales that seem to shift, like the sky on a cloudy day.  You tear your eyes from this optical illusion just in time to see the long gazelle-slender neck swing around to get a better look at you--and in time to see the graceful jaws twist into a snarl.

mobs.long_desc: An old woman in a floral-print dress seems surprised to see you.
mobs.desc: You're astonished--this woman seems completely out of place in this underground city.  Matronly, in her late middle age, she seems more like a grandmother than a threat to consider seriously.  And your suspicions are borne out when you see her whirl around, dropping children's toys to the ground in a loud clatter. She sets her jaw resolutely when she sees you looking at her.  "You'll have to get through me if you want the child," she whispers grimly.

mobs.long_desc: A dark-robed figure embraces the storms here.
mobs.desc: You see a middle-aged man in an elegant robe.  Time has been kind to the Stormlord--he's extremely attractive, with thick, very light blonde hair held in back by a velvet ribbon.  The robe is open, showing his graceful, slender form's velvet clothes.  He waves a silk-bloused arm, a gesture really, and thunder sounds very close by.  He laughs, mostly to himself.  He doesn't seem threatened in the least.

mobs.long_desc: A battle-hardened warrior in worn leathers seems to appear out of nowhere!
mobs.desc: The man before you is immediately familiar.  You've heard of the Jann in stories told by humbled warriors from nearly every land you've visited.  Your practiced eye tells you that he is a nomad, a traveller.  The Jann are the only race capable of traversing the Planes without any form of assistance.  They are also so formidable that other Planes' denizens do not molest them.  Being of no Plane at all, they are of them all.  This Jann seems quite representative of the genre--muscular, dark-haired and amber-skinned, hard-eyed, covered in old scars.

mobs.long_desc: A soldier dressed in an ancient uniform stands here.
mobs.desc: His bearing is proud.  His uniform, though clearly old, is extremely well kept, a marker of his pride in his job.  The uniform's look and cut declare it to be at least several hundreds years old--it's right out of a history book!  But the soldier himself looks young and spry.  You judge him to be a very proficient fighter.  What is he guarding?  What is he trying to accomplish? And who gave him his orders, whatever they are?

mobs.long_desc: Wisps of air hang before you.
mobs.desc: It's just air.  You would swear to that if you thought it would help.  But it's not just air.  That's painfully obvious.  Though it's nothing more than a slight disturbance in front of you, you realize with a start that the disturbance is more than a mere change in air currents.  It's the herald of a creature with a mind all its own.

mobs.long_desc: Glowing eyes hang suspended in the middle of some wisps of air.
mobs.desc: You almost don't realize that those are glowing red eyes.  In fact, you almost walked into them a second ago, and almost fell down in startlement.  But they are eyes, indeed, you realize, and along with them is a subtle shift in the air.  You are facing a creature composed of air.  How in the world are you supposed to fight it?

mobs.long_desc: A well-dressed man tends to the roost here.
mobs.desc: This man is obviously held in high esteem by the master of the underground city.  He wears well-tailored brown leather breeches, a cream-colored silk shirt, and a dark blue leather vest.  He seems very competent and self-disciplined--he would need to be, to control the huge birds that help guard the city.

mobs.long_desc: A huge hawk flies just overhead.
mobs.desc: This immense dark-gold bird seems so large he'd feed a small tribe of hunters. Its fiercely pointed beak, piercing eyes, and swift movements indicate its long mastery of hunting inside a cavern.  It makes soft rustling noises as it moves, the breeze generated by its wings pushing you back a bit.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a glittering cloak here.

extras.text: You behold the legendary Stormcloak, once worn by the mighty Stormlord, Holder of Tempests, himself.  The dark indigo cloth the cloak is made of scintillates, giving the impression of thousands of tiny indigo-colored gems woven right into its brocade surface.  It's quite heavy, with a handspan-wide collar held together by a bronze clasp, beautifully worked into the shape of a horned demon whose raised fists make the clasp circular in form.  The ankle-length cloak is lined in black silk and edged in crimson.  Your blood stirs inside you as you look at it, touch it.

objects.ground: A bright red rubber ball rolls on the ground here.

extras.text: You see a bouncy red rubber ball! It's so big you can barely hold it in one hand. You think it'd be a lot of fun to try balancing it on your head, as well.

objects.short: the wing feather of a cavern hawk
objects.ground: An immense feather is sitting on the ground here.

extras.text: This is the primary flight feather of the giant cavern hawks near the Stormchild's keep.  Dark gold in color, it is nearly three feet long.  If someone were large enough, they could probably use it as a quill pen, but other than that it would make a nice trophy.

objects.ground: Condensation forms on a slender metallic rod lying here.

extras.text: The baton feels extremely cool to the touch, as if its brushed metal surface is pulling all the heat from its surroundings.  It feels hollow and perfectly balanced, yet the metal seems to be somewhat stronger than anything this light should be.

objects.ground: An implementation of death and destruction sits here.
Some leather thongs curl in the dirt.

extras.text: These jesses are made of thick dark-brown leather thongs wrapped around what seems to be leather gloves.  The thongs dangle a bit, but just looking at the jesses make you aware of how fast and agile a true falconer must be.  Perhaps wearing these will make you feel like that as well.

objects.ground: A key whose surface shifts like the clouds above lies here.

extras.text: You hold a beautiful key with a most fascinating property-- its surface looks like clouds, and the clouds move across it as if it were a piece of the sky.

objects.ground: You come across the Stormchild's misplaced key.

extras.text: You see a key fit for a small child-- larger than most keys, simplistic in design, and strung on a pretty red ribbon, so its wearer would be sure not to lose it.

triggers.name: shrynn fight
triggers.commands: set mode %random.10% if %mode% < 7 wait 2s if %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) && (%actor.vnum% == -1) set max_tries 5 while %max_tries% > 0 set victim %random.char% if (%victim.vnum% == -1) && (%victim.name% != %actor.name%) set okay 1 set max_tries 0 endif eval max_tries %max_tries% - 1 done if !%okay% halt endif eval actor_damage 310 + %random.100% if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval actor_damage %actor_damage% / 2 endif eval victim_damage 150 + %random.100% if %victim.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval victim_damage %victim_damage% / 2 endif msend %actor% %self.name% sucks you into his vortex, spinning you around in a blur! mechoaround %actor% %self.name% sucks %actor.name% into a vortex, spinning %actor.o% around vigorously! mdamage %actor% %actor_damage% crush eval actor_damage %damdone% mdamage %victim% %victim_damage% crush eval victim_damage %damdone% msend %actor% The vortex spits you out and flings you into headlong into %victim.name%! (&1&b%actor_damage%&0) (&4%victim_damage%&0) msend %victim% The vortex flings %actor.name% into you! (&1&b%victim_damage%&0) (&4%actor_damage%&0) mteleport %victim% 1100 mechoaround %actor% The vortex flings %actor.name% out, and right into %victim.name%! (&4%actor_damage%&0) (&4%victim_damage%&0) mteleport %actor% 1100 * Teleport back and forth to break combat mteleport %actor% %self.room% mteleport %victim% %self.room% endif else wait 2s if %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) && (%actor.vnum% == -1) eval damage 120 + %random.100% if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif mdamage %actor% %damage% crush msend %actor% &6%self.name% throws a tremendous burst of wind at you, throwing you from the area!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) mechoaround %actor% &6%self.name% throws a tremendous burst of wind at %actor.name%, throwing %actor.o% from the area!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) if %actor% &(%actor.room% == %self.room%) eval location 48801 + %random.29% mteleport %actor% %location% mforce %actor% look endif endif endif

triggers.name: blue dragon fight
triggers.commands: wait 2s set mode %random.10% if %mode% <= 1 breath lightning elseif %mode% <= 2 sweep elseif %mode% <= 4 roar elseif (%mode% <= 5) && %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) && (%actor.vnum% == -1) eval damage 290 + %random.50% if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif if %actor.aff_flagged[STONE]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif mdamage %actor% %damage% shock mecho &4&bLightning crackles across the scales of %self.name%!&0 if %damdone% == 0 msend %actor% &4A blast of lightning flows off one of the dragon's claws and harmlessly into you!&0 mechoaround %actor% &4A blast of lightning flows off one of the dragon's claws and harmlessly into %actor.name%!&0 else msend %actor% &4A blast of lightning flows off one of the dragon's claws and into your body!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) mechoaround %actor% &4A blast of lightning flows off one of the dragon's claws and into %actor.name%'s body!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) end end

triggers.name: stormchild fight
triggers.commands: wait 1s set mode %random.10% if %mode% < 5 mecho &6A sudden gale starts from nowhere, throwing lightning everywhere!&0 wait 1s m_run_room_trig 48851 elseif %mode% < 8 wait 1s m_run_room_trig 48852 else emote cries, 'Stop it, %actor.name%!' if %actor.vnum% == -1 eval damage 390 + %random.40% else * If a mob is tanking, hit it for massive damage! eval damage 1000 + %random.200% endif * Halve damage for sanc if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif mechoaround %actor% Lightning crackles around the Stormchild as she points a finger at %actor.name%. msend %actor% Lightning crackles around the Stormchild as she points a finger at you! wait 2s if %actor% && (%actor.room% == 48851) msend %actor% The lightning overloads, flowing into a shocking blast flowing straight for you! mechoaround %actor% The lightning overloads, flowing into a shocking blast flowing straight for %actor.name%! mdamage %actor% %damage% shock if %damdone% == 0 msend %actor% &4The blast plays harmlessly over your body.&0 mechoaround %actor% &4The blast plays harmlessly over %actor.name%'s body.&0 else mechoaround %actor% &4The blast strikes %actor.name% in the chest, throwing %actor.o% into the wall!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) msend %actor% &4The blast strikes you square in the chest, throwing you into the wall!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) end else mecho The lightning fizzles out around the Stormchild. endif endif

triggers.name: cloud dragon fight
triggers.commands: set mode %random.10% if %mode% <= 3 wait 2s breath frost elseif %mode% <= 6 wait 2s sweep elseif %mode% <= 8 wait 2s roar elseif %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) && (%actor.vnum% == -1) wait 1s mecho %self.name% suddenly breaks apart into &6millions of droplets of moisture&0! wait 1s if %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) eval damage 350 + %random.50% if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif mdamage %actor% %damage% cold if %damdone% == 0 msend %actor% &6The cloud of droplets envelopes you, cooling you.&0 mechoaround %actor% &6%actor.name% enjoys a nice misting from the cloud.&0 else msend %actor% &6The cloud of droplets envelopes you, draining your energy!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) mechoaround %actor% &6%actor.name% gasps for breath as the cloud of droplets envelopes %actor.o%!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) end wait 1 endif mecho &6The cloud of droplets coalesces back into the form of %self.name%.&0 endif

triggers.name: stormlord fight
triggers.commands: set mode %random.10% if %mode% < 5 wait 1s mecho &6Hurricane-force winds suddenly howl, throwing around lightning bolts!&0 wait 1s mecho &4A massive lightning bolt strikes %self.name% in the chest, causing %self.p% eyes to glow!&0 mheal stormlord 1000 elseif %mode% < 8 wait 2s emote lets out a thundering howl, causing the air around to vibrate. set max_hits 5 while %max_hits% > 0 set victim %random.char% if (%victim.vnum% == -1) &&! (%victim_list% /= %victim.name%) eval damage 150 + %random.50% if %victim.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif if %victim.aff_flagged[STONE]% * More damage for stoneskin eval damage %damage% + 80 mdamage %victim% %damage% mechoaround %victim% &3%victim.name%'s stone-like skin grows massive cracks as the thunder rolls into %victim.o%.&0 (&4%damdone%&0) msend %victim% &3The thundering howl shatters your stone-like skin, causing immense pain!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) else mdamage %victim% %damage% crush if %damdone% == 0 mechoaround %victim% &3%victim.name% holds %victim.p% ground.&0 msend %victim% &3You hold your ground.&0 else mechoaround %victim% &3%victim.name% holds %victim.p% head and cries out in pain!&0 (&4%damage%&0) msend %victim% &3Pain breaks out in your head as the thunder pounds your ears!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) end endif set victim_list %victim_list% %victim.name% endif eval max_hits %max_hits% - 1 done else wait 1s mecho &4Lightning begins to crackle around %self.name%'s right arm.&0 wait 1s if %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) && (%actor.vnum% == -1) mecho &4The glowing lightning flows into %self.name%'s index finger.&0 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% points %self.p% finger at %actor.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% points %self.p% finger at you. eval damage 350 + %random.100% if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif mdamage %actor% %damage% shock if %damdone% == 0 msend %actor% A blast of lighting strikes you, lighting you up! mechoaround %actor% A blast of lighting strikes %actor.name%, lighting %actor.o% up! else mechoaround %actor% A tremendous blast of lightning strikes %actor.name%, burning %actor.p% skin! (&4%damdone%&0) msend %actor% A tremendous blast of lightning strikes you, tearing at your flesh! (&1&b%damdone%&0) end endif endif

triggers.name: birdmaster fight
triggers.commands: if %get.mob_count[48815]% < 6 wait 1s emote holds a bird whistle to his lips and lets out a loud whistle! wait 1s mload mob 48815 mforce cavern-hawk emote swoops in to the aid of %self.name%! mforce cavern-hawk hit %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: stormchild heal
triggers.commands: wecho &4The Stormchild's eyes open wide as a massive lightning bolt strikes her in the chest!&0 wheal stormchild 1000

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: wecho The Stormchild opens her mouth in a scream, and a wave of thunder rolls out! set person %self.people% while %person% set next %person.next_in_room% if (%person.vnum% < 48800) || (%person.vnum% > 48899) eval damage 150 + %random.50% * Halve damage for sanc if %person.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif if %person.aff_flagged[STONE]% * Double damage for stoneskin eval damage %damage% + %damage% end wdamage %person% %damage% crush if %damdone% == 0 wsend %person% The blast passes through you harmlessly. wechoaround %person% The blast passes harmlessly through %person.name%. elseif %person.aff_flagged[STONE]% wechoaround %person% &3%person.name% writhes in agony as the thunder shatters %person.p% stony skin!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) wsend %person% &3You writhe in agony as the thunder shatters your stony skin!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) else wechoaround %person% &3%person.name% cries out in pain as the thunderclap pounds %person.p% eardrums!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) wsend %person% &3You cry out in pain as the thunderclap pounds your eardrums!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) endif endif set person %next% done

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: * This trigger is now handled in 48806 if !%tank% halt endif set person %self.people% while %person% set next %person.next_in_room% if %tank% /= %person.name% if %person.vnum% == -1 eval damage 390 + %random.40% else * If a mob is tanking, hit it for massive damage! eval damage 1000 + %random.200% endif * Halve damage for sanc if %person.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif wechoaround %person% Lightning crackles around the Stormchild as she points a finger at %person.name%. wsend %person% Lightning crackles around the Stormchild as she points a finger at you! wait 2s if %person% && (%person.room% == 48851) wdamage %person% %damage% shock wsend %person% The lightning overloads, flowing into a shocking blast flowing straight for you! wechoaround %person% The lightning overloads, flowing into a shocking blast flowing straight for %person.name%! if %damdone% == 0 wechoaround %person% &4The blast passes right through %person.name%'s chest!&0 wsend %person% &4The blast goes right through you, striking the wall!&0 else wechoaround %person% &4The blast strikes %person.name% in the chest, throwing %person.o% into the wall!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) wsend %person% &4The blast strikes you square in the chest, throwing you into the wall!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) end else wecho The lightning fizzles out around the Stormchild. endif unset tank halt endif set person %next% done

triggers.name: stormchild tank
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == 48806 set tank %speech% global tank endif

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Realm of Air
rooms.description: Swirling mists surround you.  Tendrils of smoke seem to curl around your legs, your feet, your arms, obscuring your vision.  You can't see very far at all.  A screaming wind that seems far off in the distance chills you to the bone.  Lightning arcs across the sky above you, huge fiery bolts of silver that are followed by thunder so loud it rocks the ground.  A grand arch stands on the cloud-ground.  A pair of proud dragons flank an inscription: THE ELEMENTAL REALM OF THE AIR You are horrified, on one level, but excited on another.  If you are attempting to gain entrance to Lokari's Keep, this is your last stop. But if you're not, then be forewarned...This is not a place to tread lightly or without due diligence and wariness.  Are you ready to face the perils ahead?

North.description: The Elemental Plane of Air looms before you.

rooms.name: A Light Mist
rooms.description: The ground seems to be composed of a cloud-like substance.  Only through the use of magic could navigation in this realm be possible.  What is under these clouds, however, is unknown.  The clouds above seem to be darkening to the north.  The archway still stands to the south, a forbidding grey stone against the grey sky.  As the mists clear below, they reveal a very long drop down into darkness.

North.description: You think you see a solid place in the fog to the north.

South.description: The Gateway is visible to the south.

Down.description: Below you, you can see only a dark pit.

rooms.name: A Horn of Rock
rooms.description: Serendipity leads to a tall spire of rock.  Its base is located here, though you the top of it cannot be seen due to the mist that curls around it.  This spot may offer a bit of respite, perhaps settle down from flight and rest, if necessary.  Enemies, though, could attack from any direction.

North.description: You can see that the mist continues to the north.

East.description: The Plane of Air continues to the east.

South.description: Far to the south, you see the Gateway.

West.description: The wind is gruesomely powerful to the west.

rooms.name: A Sudden Gale
rooms.description: How did this happen?  Suddenly fierce winds are whipping about where there once was calm.  Even placing small steps seems impossible now.  There is no option but to stumble along, praying to the Gods for their guidance in the right direction.  The winds push in all directions, to the north and west, even downward, but they seem stronger from the south and east, making passage in those directions simply..  Impossible.  Below, the chasm beckons.

North.description: The wind is louder to the north.

West.description: You think you see a solid place to rest to the south.

Down.description: A dark, bottomless-seeming pit looms below your feet.

rooms.name: A Downdraft
rooms.description: The wind howls unbearably loud.  So loud, in fact, that gear and armor rattle from it.  The winds push to the east, but an undercurrent pushes upward. There is a moment of panic!  Which route should be followed.  The decision should be made quickly, before you get sucked under!

East.description: You can see that the storm seems to have passed by the east already.

Up.description: The Plane of Air sweeps upward here.

Down.description: You get a sense of foreboding when you look down, but you can't see anything directly threatening.

rooms.name: The Edge of Oblivion
rooms.description: It is a long way to safety from here, at the bottom of a windpool.  The clouds below are thin, and allow a downward look into...  Pure oblivion.  The sense of danger, grave, horrible danger, is overcoming.  One misstep could spell doom.  You can swim upward if you wish, or contemplate infinity here.

Up.description: You could claw your way out of this whirlpool by going up, you think.

Down.description: Oblivion beckons at your feet. A dawning horror makes you realize what danger you are in.

rooms.name: A Sweeping Wind
rooms.description: The winds here seem more guiding here-- not too rough, and not too gente. There is a sense of peace here, as if the winds here were friendly, an ally perhaps.  There is an exits to the west, or dive downward.

West.description: The Plane of Air continues to the west.

Down.description: The Plane of Air continues below you.

rooms.name: A Gentle Breeze
rooms.description: How beautiful!  The sun peeks out from behind the clouds overhead in places, and the breezes play all around, with gentle touches, almost shyly.  The clouds underneath seem a little firmer, too.  Maybe this would make a good resting spot?  There are exits to the north or west from here.  Far below, a mysterious Chasm beckons.

North.description: You hear only silence to the north.

West.description: The mists continue to the west.

Down.description: Below you, a black pit looms.

rooms.name: Dead Calm
rooms.description: There is a sense here that something is dreadfully wrong.  The air is perfectly still.  Not even a breeze to speak of.  The air smells funny, too, almost stale.  Above, the air seems a little cooler, but overall, nothing affects where you are right now.  The mists are thin enough below to allow another glimpse of the Chasm that underlies this entire realm.

South.description: You can tell that the winds seem gentler to the south.

Up.description: You feel warmth on your skin when you look up.

Down.description: A black pit reminds you of what could happen if you lose the ability to float.

rooms.name: The Wildwind
rooms.description: The wind is like a living thing, some great, ponderous, ancient beast that seems to be capable of stealing souls, drawing it by force from its victim. There is a pulling force, dragging adventurers along the cloudlike ground. There are exits north or down, though it looks like pretty hard going.

North.description: You think the storms to the north are milder.

Down.description: The mists continue below you.

rooms.name: The Wildwind
rooms.description: The wind is so strong you're not sure how you can even see through your squinting eyes.  Bits of grit and sand blast against you.  Above you, the sky roils as though in the throes of agony.  The noise is so great you can't hear a thing, only the pounding of your blood in your ears and the screaming wind. The wind has weakened the cloud floor somewhat.  The deep pit that seems to underly this entire region is right below you, beckoning.

East.description: You think you can detect a solid spot of ground to the east.

Up.description: The storm continues upward.

Down.description: An utterly dark pit opens right below your feet!

rooms.name: A Light Storm
rooms.description: The clouds are a pleasing shade of medium-grey, lit up in places with the periodic lightning that flashes past the huge bowl of the sky.  The raindrops that start falling as you stand in the room are cooling to your storm-warmed skin, almost refreshing.  The winds the sift through the raindrops are light and cool on your face, as well.  From here, you can go north, south, or east, unless you fall into the chasm below the thin mist at your feet.

North.description: The winds continue to the north.

East.description: The winds continue to the east.

South.description: The storm seems much worse to the south!

Down.description: A chasm looms right below your feet, beneath the mists below you.

rooms.name: A Light Storm
rooms.description: The storm is mild here.  The winds are cool and refreshing, the mists pushed back by their gentle pressure.  The rain falls in small droplets, their scent sweet.  You can go north, west, or downward, though in all of these directions, you can see that the storm increases in strength.

North.description: You think you see a solid bit of ground to the north.

West.description: The light storm continues to the west.

Down.description: The mists continue below you.

rooms.name: Buffeting Winds
rooms.description: You're pushed back and forth by the winds.  It's almost confusing-- at first you're pushed in one direction, and then they switch direction and come at you from a whole other direction.  You can go south or east from here.  The mist at your feet doesn't quite conceal a dark pit.

East.description: You see a solid horn of rock to your east.

South.description: The storm lightens to the south.

Down.description: You see a dark chasm right below your feet.

rooms.name: A Horn of Rock
rooms.description: The wind is fairly strong here, but not too difficult to walk through.  It howls and curls around a spire of rock that juts from below, to further above your head.  You realize you can rest here if you need to, though enemies can attack you from the west, south, and below.

South.description: You see a light storm to the south.

West.description: The wind seems strong to the west.

Up.description: Above you, you think you see horribly strong winds!

rooms.name: The Hurricane
rooms.description: You find yourself in a sudden, inexplicable, completely overpowering storm! The winds are insanely strong, ripping you apart.  The rain falls in sheets, the droplets falling on your body with a force you couldn't hardly imagine. The skies are dark, an ominous and angry shade of grey.  Lightning flashes. All in all, a horrifying storm.  You can go north or east, or cower here for a bit.  You see that the mists have parted below you, revealing an ominous, deep valley.

North.description: It's ominously quiet to the north.

East.description: The storms continue to the east.

Down.description: A chasm looms below your feet.

rooms.name: A Howling Wind
rooms.description: The wind is strong, and it pushes you in all different directions.  The clouds overhead are intimidatingly dark.  To the north and west, especially, the growing storm seems overwhelming.  You can also go east or upward, or to the Chasm below.

North.description: The winds grow more violent.

East.description: The winds continue to the east.

West.description: The storm just gets stronger to the west.

Up.description: Above your head, the winds seem even stronger.

Down.description: A dark pit is visible through the mists below your feet.

rooms.name: A Brewing Storm
rooms.description: The fog recedes a bit, allowing you to see the dark clouds overhead.  There is no rain, but the entire world seems to be holding its breath waiting for the droplets to start falling.  There is a sense of impending disaster here, gritty to the mental taste.  Below you, you see the Chasm opening to receive you should you fall!

South.description: A huge horn of rock, big enough to rest on, stands to the south.

Up.description: Above your head, the Plane continues.

Down.description: Below your feet, you see a dark, apparently bottomless, pit.

rooms.name: A Sudden Gale
rooms.description: How did this happen?  The storm that envelopes you now seems to have come out of nowhere!  The torrential rain sweeps down from the black clouds above, pelting you with huge droplets.  The wind is powerful, consuming, and very very pushy.  You can go south or east from here.  Below you, you see the Chasm.

East.description: The winds continue to the east.

South.description: The winds continue to the south.

Down.description: You see a horrible dark chasm right below you.

rooms.name: A Howling Wind
rooms.description: The winds in this part of the elemental realm of air seem to be crying out something, but it can't quite be placed...  It's something, an undercurrent, below the threshold of hearing, that can almost be heard if you listen with utmost concentration.  Unfortunately, this is not the time for that.  All concentration must be used to travel across this bit of the realm.  The wind has pushed the mists below aside.  There is a dark abyss far below.

South.description: The noise is getting louder to the south.

West.description: The storm is increasing in intensity to the west.

Up.description: The storm has abated.

Down.description: You can't even see the bottom of the pit below your feet.

rooms.name: The Hurricane
rooms.description: The power of the storm is intense!  This must be the hurricane, the ravager of the coast that is often spoken in sailors' tales of old.  What is said of them....  They're strong, last for varying lengths of time, and can kill...

North.description: You see a horn of rock to the north.

Up.description: Above your head, the winds continue.

Down.description: Below you, a horn of rock arcs off, out of sight.

rooms.name: The Eye of the Storm
rooms.description: You step into the eye, and experience calm.  Complete and utter quiet.  The storm howls all around, sure, but here in this spot, there is only tranquility. Well, almost.  In an instant the storm could change direction and decimate anything in it's path.  Or perhaps not.  Perhaps this entire storm was created by something?  Something doesn't seem right about its stationary position. You don't believe for a second that this storm has moved from where it is since the beginning of time.  But what could have created it?  The storm continues in all directions except east and downwards, where there appears to be some kind of tunnel.

North.description: The storm continues to the north.

East.description: The storm continues to the east.

South.description: The storm continues to the south.

Down.description: Below you, you see some kind of tunnel.

rooms.name: The Hurricane
rooms.description: You find yourself in the middle of an extremely violent storm.  The winds scream past you, pushing you around in every direction.  You wonder if crawling on your hands and knees would help you get around.  The rain comes down in sheets.  The wind smells somehow stale, as if it's been a long time since fresh winds came in from above or below the clouds that surround this place.  Below you a deep abyss threatens to engulf you!

North.description: The storms continue to the north.

South.description: The storms continue to the south.

West.description: For some reason, the storm seems nonexistent to the west.

Down.description: A deep pit looms beneath you. You don't think you could get out of it if you fell into it.

rooms.name: Screaming Winds
rooms.description: The hurricane has spawned fierce windstorms that travel all over this realm! You struggle through it, freezing cold even in your equipment, squinting into the rain to try to gain some idea where you are.  It's almost impossible to walk in a straight line.  You can struggle to the north or downwards, though both ways look thoroughly hostile.

North.description: The Plane of Air continues to the north.

Down.description: Below you, the storms continue.

rooms.name: A Howling Wind
rooms.description: The clouds above seem angry with you.  They're bunched together, just as they always seem to be, but they're black, lit occasionally by lightning.  The wind that caresses your face seems to do it with malicious intent.  As you look, you suddenly see a flash of blue, a serpentine, silvery form, flying far above your head.  What is it?  You shift where you stand, unwilling to find out, but wary of what it might be.

North.description: You see a shining cloud to the north.

Down.description: Below you, you see a horrible storm.

rooms.name: The Hurricane
rooms.description: Now you're sure this violent, powerful storm isn't exactly natural.  It rages all around you, but it's got a tired feel to it, as if it's been here for some time.  You concentrate, and senses gained over years of traveling the world seeking adventure seem to hone in on a sense of wrongness about this storm.  You wander through it, tossed this way and that by the wind and rain, hoping lightning won't hit you.  You can go east, south, or upwards, though nowhere does the storm seem as bad as where you are now.  Below you you see a terrifying abyss.

East.description: The storm continues to the east.

South.description: It's strangely calm to the south.

Up.description: A pea-soup-thick fog billows above your head.

Down.description: A pit is visible through the mists at your feet. You doubt you could get out of it if you fell into it.

rooms.name: A Howling Wind
rooms.description: The wind is fierce and overpowering here, as it is in so many other places you've seen in this realm.  It pushes you to the east, west, and north.  The south, however, is a thick wall of fog.  You can't even see through it.  You can, however, see below you, to where the mists have parted enough to show you a monstrous Chasm.  Should you fall, it would surely be impossible to get up again.

North.description: A very thick fog clouds your vision to the north.

East.description: The storms continue to the east.

West.description: You see a massive curved horn of rock curving in the west.

Down.description: Far, far below your feet, visible through the mists, you see a deep chasm.

rooms.name: The Spinning Tornado
rooms.description: The tornado picks you up as if you were a rag doll, shaking you and pushing you violently.  You struggle to regain your footing, though you know that fighting makes it more difficult to get through the tornado's wrath.  You could go north, to a place that seems a little calmer, west, or south.  You would never have believed you could feel so battered by mere air!  A Chasm beneath your feet is so deep you cannot see its bottom.

North.description: The mist is thicker here.

South.description: The winds seem stronger to the south.

West.description: The winds seem stronger here.

Down.description: A deep chasm is visible below the mists at your feet.

rooms.name: A Column of Mist
rooms.description: The column rises up right through the clouds overhead.  It's not clouds; it's almost fog, but tightly-packed fog.  You could travel up it, you think, though you don't know precisely what awaits you there.  You can also journey to the south or west, or go downwards.

South.description: A storm rages to the south.

West.description: The mist thickens to fog to the west.

Up.description: The mists continue above your head.

Down.description: You hear the wind howling below you.

rooms.name: Thick Fog
rooms.description: The fog is so thick you can't even see your hand waving in front of your face!  The scent, so redolent of stone and rain and age, seems to clog your nose.  Tiny droplets of mist cling to your skin and clothes.  You desperately hope you won't trip over anything.  The fog swallows your body from the knees down.  And it ends to the north, in a solid wall of fog that you can actually feel.

North.description: A door made of misty glass stands to the north.

East.description: The mists continue to the east.

South.description: A storm rages to the south.

Down.description: A horrible storm rages below you!

rooms.name: An Inconspicuous Hole
rooms.description: You stumble here, surprised at what you find.  You find yourself inside a cave of tightly packed earth, with rocky walls and stalactites forming from the ceiling, which drips brackish-smelling water onto the dirt floor.  Why is there a cave in the Realm of Air?  Nothing in here seems very remarkable-- just a cave mouth, honestly.  Why would there be a locked door in here?

South.description: The door painted to resemble clouds stands to the south.

Down.description: When you look down, you notice that some pebbles on the floor form a handle, but you can't see any doors.

rooms.name: The Cloud-Dragon's Lair
rooms.description: You enter a scene of unsurpassing beauty-- a hill of clouds!  Small wisps of clouds seem to "grow" from the sides of the hill, almost like trees or bushes. The hill isn't large, though it is broad at its top.  You can see why, too: A nest made of some iridescent white stuff sits on the hilltop.  You can't think of anything big enough to require such a nest, nor what it's made of.  Spun pearly strands, it looks like.

South.description: A storm rages to the south.

Down.description: You see a solid horn of rock arching below you.

rooms.name: Warm Winds
rooms.description: The calm to the west gives way to a place where warm, balmy breezes scud about.  This place lies in stark contrast to the parts of this realm, which tossed violent winds and storms upon you.  The clouds overhead look ominous. It is utterly silent below you.

Up.description: The winds continue above you.

Down.description: It's utterly silent below you.

rooms.name: A Wind Tunnel
rooms.description: Raw wind going east-west drags across your body, pulling you to the east. What's going on to the east?  The clouds overhead and underfoot end completely. You squint to look around you, but there are no answers.  Westward, the winds seem a bit calmer-- at least, there aren't so many bits of debris flying around.

West.description: The winds continue to the west.

Up.description: You think you hear faint popping noises above you. What could it be?

Down.description: Light winds play below you.

rooms.name: A Den Mouth
rooms.description: You find yourself in a dark cave that obviously serves as the home of some fierce animal.  Bones pile in every corner of this cave.  It's rather dark, and the footing is uneven enough that you have to carefully feel your way through this place.  A smell of death comes from the south.

South.description: Something smells horrible to the south.

Up.description: You think you can push some of these rocks aside.

rooms.name: A Littered Cave
rooms.description: This end of the den is obviously a cave, and not a big one, at that.  You travel over rough, packed dirt, feeling your way through the cave, wincing when your feet touch and avoid unknown hard objects-- bones?  You hope that's the worst of what you'll find here.

North.description: You can see where the cave ends in a sort of den to the north.

East.description: You think you see a tunnel to the east.

rooms.name: A Paved Tunnel
rooms.description: Strangely enough, you find yourself walking on a paved tunnel.  The tunnel is lit very dimly by wall sconces, allowing you to see the way-- almost.  You are grateful for the paving, which is probably all that keeps you from stumbling as you travel to the south or west.

South.description: The tunnel curves to the south.

West.description: You see a cave to the west.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Paved Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel was made by intelligent hands, of that you are sure.  It's too even, and too well made, to have been carved by the elements over thousands of years.  It is lit very dimly by candles in wall sconces.  You notice that the dark blue candles in the candleholders look brand new, even though they have to have been burning for hours, if not weeks.  What a chilling touch.

North.description: The tunnel continues to the north.

East.description: You see huge stone gates to the east.

rooms.name: A Pair of Majestic Stone Gates
rooms.description: You can sense that you are underground, even without seeing the roof of the huge cavern above your head.  This is the vastest cave you've ever seen! Winds swirl around your head, but you can't find their source.  And before you, to the east, lies a small city, built right underground!  You're amazed by its complexity.  A tower rises to your north.  To the south, you see a stone wall. To the east, the city spreads all the way to the cavern's far wall.

North.description: A stone tower rises to your north.

East.description: You can go east through the gates, if you wish.

West.description: A paved tunnel goes west from here.

rooms.name: The Roost
rooms.description: It smells very powerfully of bird here.  You carefully walk around bird droppings, looking with awe at the giant birdcage you've found yourself in. The birdcage is walled in stone.  Perches as thick as your wrist hang from various places.  Whatever type of bird lives here has built nests all over this roost.  A small structure, boxlike with clear walls, on legs like a table, holds what you tentatively identify as more eggs.  When you touch the clear walls, you feel how warm they are.  Perhaps this room is a breeding room for the birds.  But where are the birds, then?

East.description: The birdmaster's quarters are to the east.

rooms.name: A Guard Tower
rooms.description: You enter what is obviously a guard tower.  It's rather small, supporting a staircase of some kind, a table, and a comfortable looking chair that, presumably, a guard could sit in while watching people through the narrow windows.  Through the windows, you see the stone gates of this underground city.

South.description: The stone gates rise to the south.

Up.description: You can go further up the guard tower.

rooms.name: The Top of the Guard Tower
rooms.description: It's barren up here-- a hard-backed chair, and a small table with crumbs on it.  The chair and table are set right next to a narrow window.  When you walk across the wooden plank floor and look outside the window, you see the stone gates of the underground city below you.  The huge cavern stretches in all directions that you can see through the narrow windows set in eight directions in the tower.  Where did the cavern come from?  Who lives here?

Down.description: A wooden staircase leads downward.

rooms.name: Inside the Stone Gates
rooms.description: The gates to the west open into a pleasant courtyard.  The ground is packed earth, and there are no green things, but otherwise, it looks like any other courtyard back home.  Stone statues of gargoyles adorn the courtyard paths, which branch off in all directions.  Oddly enough, a child's wooden horse lies in a corner, forgotten.

North.description: A carved passageway goes off to the north.

East.description: A stone path goes off to the east.

South.description: The birdmaster's quarters are to the south.

West.description: The gates to the underground city are to the west.

rooms.name: The Birdmaster's Quarters
rooms.description: This must be where the Stormchild's Birdmaster lives.  The one-room home is beautifully carved wood.  The windows are all of carefully made glass panes, bevelled on the edges where they are soldered together.  Some well-made chairs sit next to a wooden table with eagle's-foot legs.  A lamp with a painted lampshade sits on the table.  A plain bed, also carved with eagle's feet, is covered by a simple linen bedspread embroidered with clouds.

North.description: The inside of the stone gates is to the north.

South.description: You see some kind of eyrie to the south.

West.description: You see a bird's roost to the west.

rooms.name: The Eyrie
rooms.description: You are awed by the sheer grandeur of this area, though it's nothing grand in and of itself-- just what are clearly bird perches, huge ones, in the center of a sort of mound.  Birds could take off from here and fly the entire cavern all around you freely.  But what birds they'd have to be!  Even the feathers are the length of your body!  But where are the birds?  You see none of them. The birdmaster's quarters are to the north.

North.description: The birdmaster's quarters are to the north.

rooms.name: A Carved Passageway
rooms.description: A subterranean passageway, your senses tell you immediately.  Even though you are entirely surrounded by rock, you can tell you are far underground. You wonder why this passageway exists, and who built it.  Exit to the north and south is possible.

North.description: A stone cot stands to the north.

South.description: You see a pair of stone gates to the south.

rooms.name: A Stone Cot
rooms.description: You enter an underground cottage.  The passageway to the south opens up into a sort of porch.  Beyond that, you step into what is clearly a well-made home for four soldiers.  Two-high bunk beds, two of them, rest against the far wall. A wooden table, plainly made, sits in one corner, surrounded by four matching and equally plain chairs.  Some pictures are on the wall-- finely made swords and beautiful women.  The pictures look immensely old and the few clothes on the women look like things people might have worn a hundred years ago.

South.description: A stone passageway runs to the south.

rooms.name: The Keeper's Chambers
rooms.description: You find yourself in a homey, sweet set of rooms.  The front room is small, but densely furnished with overstuffed furniture in floral prints.  Wooden bookshelves line the west wall, filled with leather bound books, their spines in a language you can't read.  Houseplants, mushroom plants, things that would survive without sunlight, are in pots all over the place, and hanging from the ceiling from little hooks.  The bedroom is attached to the living room.  The bed is thick and soft, covered in a lavishly embroidered spread, done in a design of big red and blue flowers.  A woman must live here, you realize.  You wonder what her function is.

South.description: A paved pathway leads off to the south.

rooms.name: A Broad Subterranean Path
rooms.description: You can tell this used to be a city, all constructed underground-- why? Who came here first, and looked around, and said "Yes, this looks like a good place to have a city"?  The cavern is huge, monstrous, reaching far in all directions, its ceiling so high you can't see much detail of its furthest reaches.  The path itself is hacked from living rock, you can tell, as are the walls of the city.  Towers and walls rise here and there, grey in the half-light given off by the candles in their magical sconces.

North.description: You notice an open door to the north; beyond that, you see a comfortable-seeming set of rooms.

East.description: You see a brightly painted set of rooms to the east.

West.description: A pair of stone gates stands to the west.

rooms.name: The Stormchild's Den
rooms.description: What a peculiar place!  You walk into what is clearly a child's home. There are no elaborate decorations, no paintings on the wall.  But the furniture is smaller than average, and there are brightly colored pillows on the floor, thrown with casual randomness.  Toys are all over the place, though a large chest in one corner holds most of them, you'd guess.  The room is very bright, lit by numerous torches that burn brighter than sunshine would.  The torches are held in sconces far above the reach of a child.  The walls are also painted bright white, instead of the grey natural stone you've seen elsewhere. All in all, you find yourself in a bright, cheerful, toy-covered playroom. The house continues to the south, or you can leave to the west.

South.description: The Stormchild's home continues to the south.

West.description: A path leads off to the west.

rooms.name: The Stormchild's Bedroom
rooms.description: You enter a sweet white-painted room.  A plush pink carpet lines the entire floor, keeping the chill off a child's bare toes.  A small, child-sized bed is up against the center of the southern wall, a four-poster bed with a ruffled canopy and a thick white comforter spread over the mattresses like icing on a cake.  Little framed pictures adorn the walls--flowers, pixies flying over clouds, and baby dragons.  It's adorable.  Along the western wall you see another toy chest--much bigger than anything any normal child should need. Toys spill out of it.

North.description: The Stormchild's home continues to the north.

East.description: The toy chest reveals a false side that looks a lot deeper than you'd previously thought.

rooms.name: A Filthy Tunnel
rooms.description: You tumble into a dark, dank, and dangerous-seeming hole in the ground. Your nose rebels at the scent, which permeates the entire room with the stench of rotted meat.  Shreds of old clothes and scraps of paper line the tunnel, for now you can see that it's a tunnel.  It leads to the east in a sloping line. The tunnel continues to the east, but is blocked to the west.

East.description: The tunnel continues to the east.

West.description: You could shimmy through a tiny hole in the wall if you liked, though it appears blocked.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Filthy Tunnel
rooms.description: The underground tunnel bends here.  You almost trip in the scraps of paper and cloth and metal that line the floor.  It stinks, too, so much that you can barely tolerate being here.  There seems to be light up to the north, or you could always swallow your nausea and head west.

North.description: The tunnel opens up into a hall to the north.

West.description: The tunnel continues to the west.

rooms.name: A Dim Hall
rooms.description: The horrible tunnel to the south has become a cleaner, paved hallway.  The hall is arched above your head, still very tunnel-like, but the walls are smoother somehow, as if someone took a little care to make the tunnel nicer and just got stuck before making the entire thing nice.  Odd.

North.description: The light to the north almost blinds you!

South.description: A tunnel goes off to the south.

rooms.name: A Shining Path
rooms.description: You can't tell where the light is coming from, but it's very bright in here. The walls, you see now, are very subtly carved with the images of fantastic beasts and heroes from legend, all along their light grey length.  The floor, also, has become smooth and polished, not plain dirt or rock.  Ahead, you can hear a light "thrumm" noise, almost mechanical in nature.

North.description: You see a hall to the north ending in a huge double-door gate.

South.description: You see a dark hall to the south.

rooms.name: The Keep Gates
rooms.description: The beautiful, shining hall to the south seems to fade away like magic, leaving you free to consider what is now before you. Here lies a magnificent portal fashioned like a stone archway. The sky is an amazing mixture of colors-- grey, deep blue, roaring crimson, and an inexplicable brown. The winds are so strong they nearly topple you. Mists swirl all around the portal, and, etched above it, in flowing letters reads: THE HOME OF THE GOD OF THE MOONLESS NIGHT BE YE BRAVE, YE MIGHT SURVIVE THE QUEST The clouds swirl around, and lightning flashes here and there, as if to accent the danger that is so close at hand. The air in the archway shimmers with an alien light, beckoning.

North.description: As you approach the archway, you see a single lock floating in the center of the shimmering air. The lock, a simple-seeming block of bronze, has, in its center, a single keyhole.

South.description: Light to the south blinds you temporarily.

rooms.name: A Column of Mist
rooms.description: The tunnel is made of what seems to be solid mist.  You can't tell how thick it is, though it feels very thick, enough to withstand the winds outside.  The column continues upward, as well as downward, and there are openings in its sides to the north and west that you could go through.  There are no stairs, though.  How would you go up or down without them?

North.description: The mists continue to the north.

West.description: The mists continue to the west.

Up.description: A storm seems to be beginning above you.

Down.description: The mists form a column leading downwards.

rooms.name: A Heavy Mist
rooms.description: You stand in the middle of a chokingly thick white mist that blocks your sight in all directions.  By holding your hands out in front of you and hoping fervently that you won't touch anything living, or too-recently deceased, you discover exits to the south and further up the entire column of mist.

South.description: The mists continue to the south.

Up.description: You see a kind of lair hidden in the mists.

rooms.name: A Rising Storm
rooms.description: You are inside a massive tower made of what seems like white mist.  The sides are solid, but very giving to the touch, and when you reach out, you can feel moisture invading your clothes, soaking you to the skin.  The tower is much bigger than it looked from outside, but you have no way of proving that-- you can't see a thing!  The mist is choking you!  Worse yet, you can feel winds rising all around you, and the moisture is much worse here than it seems below. You can go north from here, you think, or further up or down the tunnel of mist.

North.description: You see a kind of lair hidden in the thick mist.

Up.description: A crushing storm rages above you.

Down.description: Only mists seem to swirl below you.

rooms.name: The Stormlord's Lair
rooms.description: The mists part just enough, in this huge tunnel of mist, for you to see that you now float in the middle of something's lair.  Floating against the mist walls are red mists and blue mists, combining to make purple in places.  The effect is nearly iridescent.  Merely being able to see makes a big difference to you-- it's almost a religious experience, not having to wonder what's right in front of you.  Unfortunately, if it's livable in here, something must live here.

South.description: A storm rages to the south.

West.description: The storm seems most powerful to the west.

Down.description: Mists swirl below your feet.

rooms.name: The Storm's Home
rooms.description: The storm is at its most powerful here.  You are blown against the sides of the column of mist, your body pounded unmercifully by the winds, pummeled by the strong rain.  You can barely see if you squint, and even then, you barely trust the evidence of your eyes.  You can go only to the east-- which looks a lot friendlier than where you are now.

East.description: A lair in the mists beckons you east.

rooms.name: The Maelstrom
rooms.description: You struggle against fierce storm winds that throw your body about like a bit of paper.  The rain that falls down on your abused body, blocking your breathing, forcing you to close your eyes, is almost solid, as if you were inside a waterfall.  Maybe you are..  You detect a way out, to the north, though you can't be sure.  Or you could allow the crushing current to pound you downward again.

North.description: You can't quite tell what's to the north -- is that the dripping of water you hear?

Down.description: A storm is brewing below your feet.

rooms.name: Submerged!
rooms.description: You gasp for breath that doesn't exist, clawing wildly at the water for the top, and air.  Small objects slash your body as you swim frantically, desperately seeking some kind of relief..

North.description: The water seems to be a little easier to traverse to the north.

South.description: A horrible storm rages to the south.

rooms.name: Knee-Deep Water
rooms.description: You slosh through knee-deep water, grimacing at the mud underfoot that sucks at your boots.  You just know it'll be impossible to clean off, somehow.  As you go, you try to avoid the worst of the...  Things...  In the water, those things you can't identify.  The sky overhead is the strangest shade of turquoise you've ever seen, and it's mirrored by the ocean stretching before you.  But the ocean glitters, opalescent, and no matter how far you walk, it's still the same depth, barely halfway up your knee.  No islands are in evidence. It's as if somehow you ended up on an ocean, though you can't imagine how.  To the north, you notice more pearlescence...

North.description: You see a shining gateway to your north.

South.description: You're scared to go south -- it seems like the water is much deeper there.

rooms.name: Sparks in the Air
rooms.description: As you walk through the clouds, you notice little, almost inaudible "pop" noises that occur all around you.  When one goes off right next to your ear, you jump, but it doesn't hurt.  Accompanying the noises are little sparks of light.  You have no idea what it means, but you feel you should leave soon. The strange lights and noises continue to the north.

North.description: To the north, the strange lights and noises continue.

Down.description: The winds moan below your feet.

rooms.name: Sparks in the Air
rooms.description: As you walk through this region, your feet sure-footed on the soft cloud-ground, you notice, very gradually, a distinct "pop" noise that occurs every few seconds.  Accompanying the noise is a brief flash of light, just a small spark really, that does no damage to you even when it happens right next to you.

East.description: It's hot! Really hot! And bright!

South.description: To the south, the noises and lights continue.

rooms.name: The Phosphor Fields
rooms.description: The ground starts to burn!  You hop from foot to foot, astonished, looking down.  And you now see how the very ground seems to be glowing with some awful internal heat, glowing orange-pink.  The clouds overhead are clearing up, but the sky is red with more heat.  The wind is beginning to get very warm too, warm and dry, like desert winds.

East.description: The phosphor fields continue to the east.

West.description: It seems a little cooler to the west, though you hear some strange noises.

rooms.name: The Phosphor Fields
rooms.description: The ground burns!  The clouds are gone, entirely, leaving you walking on coals glowing orange-pink.  The sky is an ominous red color, with indigo clouds glaring down at you.  You race across the fields, crying out in pain, your feet in agony.  The winds that rake your body are not gentle, either; they are hot, and the ones from the north promise even greater pain.  You could retreat to the west, where it's not as hot, as well.

North.description: You reel back in pain at the sheer heat and light to the north.

West.description: To the west, the phosphor fields continue.

rooms.name: Sheer Plasma
rooms.description: You scream in pain!  Your body is flailed apart as by a thousand little white-hot knives.  You need to get out of this part of the plane FAST!  As your tortured eyes scan the dancing flames of this place, you see relief, or at least a little relief, to the south.  To the north, only pure flames seem evident.

North.description: You see an archway standing to the north.

South.description: It seems a little less torturous to the south.

rooms.name: The Gateway to the Realm of Fire
rooms.description: Fire dances all around an archway made of black stone. The archway is tall, so tall a giant could fit under it, and seemingly connecting nothing to nothing, just free-floating on the ground of fire. Carvings of fire demons go all the way up each arch's leg, and across the archway itself, you see a carving that's studded in white marble, just enough that you can make out the words, in austere lettering: THE GATEWAY TO THE ELEMENTAL REALM OF FIRE

North.description: Ahead lies the gateway, a keyhole visible in the middle of the archway, shimmering in a lockbox of pearl. You could reach past the biting flames to push a key into it...

South.description: Sheer heat and light greet you to the south.

rooms.name: An Out-of-Use-Tunnel
rooms.description: You can barely see, but your senses tell you you're deep underground, in a small cave.  The floor of loose dirt makes your footing feel unsure, but you can feel a path forming as you walk.  The cave narrows to a tunnel that goes toward the east.

East.description: The tunnel continues to the east.

Up.description: You can't hear a thing above you. Perhaps it's safe to go up now?

rooms.name: An Out-of-Use Tunnel
rooms.description: You have to stoop a little as you walk, to avoid brushing the ceiling of this tunnel.  Even so, you feel indeterminate flakes of what you desperately hope are dirt brushing off onto your clothes as you bump into the ceiling and walls.  You peer into the darkness ahead as if you could see anything at all in the blackness.

East.description: The tunnel continues to the east.

South.description: You can't see much in the dim light. Looks like lots of rocks.

West.description: The tunnel continues to the west.

rooms.name: An Out-of-Use Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel snakes into a corner of some sort, you think.  At least, your senses tell you this.  You can barely see a thing.  You don't want to reach out and feel your way through the tunnel-- you feel squeamish at the very thought of touching the walls or ceiling.  The air is musty, as if it was once alive but is now dead.  A shaft of light arcs through the air like a finger of some benevolent god, from the south.

South.description: The tunnel opens up to some kind of cave mouth to the south.

West.description: The tunnel continues to the west.

rooms.name: A Pile of Boulders
rooms.description: The cave's fallen in a little here, exposing a small roomlike cave full of boulders.  The dust has barely settled; it tickles your nose, coats your clothes with a fine light-brown mist.  You look up.  Natural light of some kind flickers through the ceiling of the cave, but not much, leading you to suspect that you're quite a ways underground.  The light just barely illuminates the shape of armor crushed beneath the boulders..  You shiver involuntarily.  You can go only north from here.

North.description: A tunnel goes off to the north.

rooms.name: The Base of the Mountain
rooms.description: You emerge from the tunnel under the mountain, blinking in a light that almost hurts your eyes.  Squinting, you can see that you can climb the mountain, which rises high above your head to the northeast.  You look back at the tunnel, holding its unknown dangers.  You know which way you'd prefer to go.

North.description: A tunnel goes off to the north.

Up.description: The air is clear, the path up the mountain solid. What could go wrong?

rooms.name: On the Mountain
rooms.description: The air here is clear, and sweet-smelling, and so pure it almost burns your lungs.  You shiver from the cold as you look across a magnificent vista of mountains that rise from far below you, to stretch far above your mountain. Scrubby bushes and brown grasses coat the mountain like dust.  No rain can have fallen here in the past season or two.  You can climb further up or down the mountain, but that's all-- the ledge surrounding the mouth of the cave won't let you go in any other direction.

Up.description: The mountain levels off into a plateau above you.

Down.description: You can go further down the mountain's side here.

rooms.name: A Mountain Plateau
rooms.description: The mountain doesn't come to a single peak, but instead, flattens to become a plateau that goes far to the north.  You walk across a pathless scrubland, dry and arid, bombarded by occasional freezing winds.  The sky, clear and so pale it looks white, stretches over you like a bowl.

North.description: The ground seems to get softer to the north. You wonder why.

Down.description: You can go further down the mountain's side here.

rooms.name: Some Soft-Turned Ground
rooms.description: The ground, which had been just hard rock, gets softer.  You look down, a little amazed.  You don't know soil as well as, say, a farmer, but when you touch the earth at your feet, you can almost feel how alive it is.  Though you'd thought the mountain was dead, it's slowly wriggling to life again.  The earth is warm and soft in your hands.

North.description: You see a sort of passageway along the soft ground.

South.description: A rocky plateau is all you see to the south.

rooms.name: Inside the Soft-Turned Ground
rooms.description: You tumble along a passageway that dumps you onto a pile of warm, soft dirt! You get up, cursing at the damage done your already-battered armor and clothes, stumbling over more dirt when you stand.  You spit out more dirt.  How could you be so clumsy?  You look around.  The light illumines a passageway heading further down.

South.description: The mountain's fertile earth continues to the south.

Down.description: The pathway down seems quite slick.

rooms.name: An Altar
rooms.description: You stand before a large cave, large enough to hold a small crowd of people. The cavern walls are clean and smooth, indicating some work on someone's part. The floor is paved with smooth stones.  And against one wall, carved from living rock from the mountain itself, is an altar.  It's carved beautifully with symmetrical designs.  On its surface, you see a few circles, as from a goblet put upon the altar.  You look around, but that's all you can see.

North.description: You see a slippery-seeming path to the north.

East.description: You see a lone gateway to the east.

rooms.name: Slippery Footing
rooms.description: Whoops!  Didn't expect the ground to get so slick, did you?  You tread a little more carefully, but it's not easy.  The rock underneath your feet must be fed by some underwater stream, because it's slippery enough to make you fall.  You think you could climb up to drier ground, but otherwise, you can go only south.

South.description: You see what's obviously an altar to the south.

Up.description: You think you might be able to get up this slippery pathway, but you're not sure at all.

rooms.name: The Gateway to the Realm of Earth
rooms.description: You stand before a huge gate.  Walls made from red-brown rock stretch far to the east and west, beyond your vision.  The gates themselves are absolutely huge- stone gates edged and reinforced in bronze, so tall you can barely see the top of them.  You can tell there's no way to get around the gate, and no way to go through, except to open the gates.  And no way to open them, without a key, you notice quickly.

East.description: Halfway up the gate doors, so high you'll barely be able to reach it, you see a bronze lock set into one of the gates.

West.description: You see what's obviously an altar to the west.

rooms.name: The Gateway to the Watery Realm
rooms.description: Water swirls around your feet, but the water is clear, not muddy, as you would expect it to be.  The water is unnaturally blue, almost as if it'd been colored that way.  And ahead of you, you see a beautiful wrought-bronze archway.  The bronze is worked into playful filigree shapes.  It looks much lighter than it probably is.  The entire archway sits in the water, with no obvious destination and no obvious supporting walls-- just a metalwork gate. The gates themselves are just thick bronze wire worked into cunning designs. You can see past the gate, to the rest of the eternal ocean that stretches in all directions.  A sunless half-light bathes the ocean, and the gate, in directionless, dim light.  You swallow as you look at the seemingly-calm scene. The Air Realm lies to the south.

North.description: The bronze lock on the gates seems too large to pick, and too sturdy to smash. It glows with some internal light.

South.description: You think you can wade through the water to the south.

rooms.name: Heavy Mists
rooms.description: You can't even see through the mists that immediately envelope you.  The mist is heavy and moist, making it difficult to breathe, impossible to see, and a feat to even move.  You reach out tentatively and feel the walls of mist that define this mist-cavern's bounds.  A low rumbling sounds from somewhere nearby. You hope it's nothing you'll accidentally touch.  You're doubly careful not to fall down, since the Chasm that magically underpins this entire plane runs right underneath your feet.

East.description: The mists continue to the east.

Down.description: Below your feet, the abyss looms.

rooms.name: A Chasm
rooms.description: You stand at the bottom of a huge chasm.  There appears to be no way in, and no way out.

North.description: The chasm continues.

East.description: The chasm continues.

South.description: The chasm continues.

West.description: The chasm continues.

rooms.name: A Chasm
rooms.description: You stand at the bottom of a huge chasm.  There appears to be no way in, and no way out.

North.description: The chasm continues.

East.description: The chasm continues.

South.description: The chasm continues.

West.description: The chasm continues.

rooms.name: A Chasm
rooms.description: You stand at the bottom of a huge chasm.  There appears to be no way in, and no way out.

North.description: The chasm continues.

East.description: The chasm continues.

South.description: The chasm continues.

West.description: The chasm continues.

rooms.name: A Chasm
rooms.description: You stand at the bottom of a huge chasm.  There appears to be no way in, and no way out.

North.description: The chasm continues.

East.description: The chasm continues.

South.description: The chasm continues.

West.description: The chasm continues.

rooms.name: A Horn of Rock
rooms.description: You come upon an outcropping of rock.  Unlike the other parts of this realm, you think you can stop here and rest without falling to your doom.  The outcropping is a spine of rock that extends horizontally, poking through the cloud floor below you, extending far above your head.  You see a hole in the clouds off to the side above you, or you can head south.  The winds seem vicious to the east.

East.description: The winds seem vicious to the east.

South.description: A hurricane rages southward.

Up.description: You see a beautiful column of clouds above your head.
